turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello there, how are you doing today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hello, great and you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Very good. I've been hearing about this charity called Save the Children, and I'm consistently amazed at what wonderful work they do.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yeah? well, tell me more about the charity

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the children is a Non-governmental organization, meaning it's independent. It promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What kind of countries? and What types of actions you make for the childrens?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Developing countries are places where the government isn't as strong, and many people live in poverty, so lots of things go unchecked that would be taken care of in more developed countries. It's important to have an independent organization look out for kids in those countries. Children are routinely treated in ways that are very bad in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: that sounds terrible, and how you help them been in other country?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: We give them medical checkups. Many children in those countries have no routine access to healthcare, so they suffer from diseases like vitamin deficiency. We also help shine the light on abuse to help get them out of abusive situations.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That sounds very good, I've a friend that is from a foreign country and they're in a bad situation in that place, so I think it's very important to help them in anyway we can

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes. Recently Save the Children helped rescue a child who was dying from hunger in one such country. They also helped relocate many children who were orphaned by Syrian Civil War. Many tragic things happen but Save the Children helps children when no one else seems to care or be capable.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Save the Children sounds amazing, so, please let me know, it's there anyway one can contribute or participate for the cause?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, you can. I donated as much as I possibly could and Save the Children told me that I helped save the lives of several children by giving them food and medical care. It really warmed my heart! I'd donate everything I had to them if I could.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That sounds amazing, and they've some webpage or some kind of way that you can see all the process that they made to help the children? I really want to know about the project in general

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, their website is  URL  Read through it and be sure to donate the maximum amount! The more kids saved the better!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Alright! Sure would do, thank you so much for all the information, you're a great person!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Your welcome! Also I think you'll like to hear that Save the Children was named as one of the ten most accountable charities in a recent study. They don't waste much on overhead. The head of the charity drives a 15 year old car!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Well, that says a lot about the people behind the charity! The webpage looks very good and legit too

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, it's pretty legit. I'd say it's one of the most legit charities out there. They regularly make sure that the whole organization is audited. You can see where all the money goes in their reports. A lot of time and effort is spent in the third world countries and so every dollar you spend goes a long way.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's exactly what I want to hear! that's it's my major concern with charities in general, to be honest, so tell me, it's something I can donated here right now?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, you can donate the maximum amount immediately.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Sorry, but right now I can't, let me organized my money and then I would go to the page

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Okay, when you get it all together you can donate your task payment between $0 and $2.
